instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO: What is PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO? PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO is a power rail .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board no sounds , had water damage
threads.message:
8203437 board , had vigorous water damage ... no all fixed .. and cleaned (had to change <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR>.. and some pad )


no the problem is no sound ... setting it showing no audi device , 

also its showing a msg in screen USB device disabled , unplug the device using too much power to re-enable USB device , pls chk pic ,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board no sounds , had water damage
threads.message: Tried new DC in board? is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> showing up on the dc in board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board no sounds , had water damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 21919"]Tried new DC in board? is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> showing up on the dc in board?[/QUOTE]

changed the dcin board now sound came back, but still on screen it says usb disabled

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board no sounds , had water damage
threads.message: could be corrosion under J9500 or a bad flat cable....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board no sounds , had water damage
threads.message: Cable should of course be changed too!
